newsitem.title: UK: First Choice chief exec quits group.
newsitem.headline: First Choice chief exec quits group.

text.p: First Choice Holidays said on Monday that chief executive Francis Baron had left the company following a breakdown in relations with other board members.

Ian Clubb, non-executive deputy chairman, will now assume an executive role and Peter Long, managing director of the group's UK Tour Operating Division, has been appointed group managing director with immediate effect.
"Francis Baron has made a major contribution to the group over the past three years, in particular in successfully re-branding and re-organising the business," said chairman Michael Julien.

"Unfortunately, his relationships with many of his key colleagues have become unworkable and in these circumstances the board felt that the continued progress of the group would be compromised if Francis remained as group chief executive," he added.
"His departure is in no way a reflection on the group's financial or trading position: booking levels for the new trading year continue to be encouraging."
